page.title: 05FARMING_A TYPICAL LOCAL FARM
page.content: THIS FARM IS TYPICAL OF THE AREA.ITS 200 ACRES CONSISTS OF 45 ACRES OF NON_GRASS CROPS,AND 117 ACRES ARE USED FOR PASTURE OR CUTTING GRASS FOR SILAGE AND HAY.SOME 33 ACRES IS UNSOWN OR FENCED OFF.THERE ARE THREE AND A HALF ACRES OF DECIDUOUS WOODLAND.THE FARM KEEPS 120 DAIRY FRESIAN COWS.A FEW GEESE ARE KEPT,TOULOUSE AND EMDEN, AND SOME SHEEP IN WINTER FOR GRASS KEEP.THE FARM HAS RECENTLY HAD TO CUT DOWN ON ITS MILK PRODUCTION BY 10%.THE FARM IS RENTED,THE FARMER BEING THE MANAGER.THE FARM HAS 3 TRACTORS, 3 TRAILERS,A MOWER,A BAILER,A MANURE SPREADER AND A 12,12 HERRING BONE MILKING PARLOUR.THEY BELIEVE THAT THE FARM WAS IN EXISTENCE AT THE TIME OF THE ORIGINAL{DOMESDAY}BOOK.THE FARM HAS ONE FULL TIME AND ONE PART TIME WORKER.THE FARM PRODUCES A LITTLE BIT OF GRAIN AS WELL.
